Description.Text: Sed Hotel is a friendly 3-star property offering stylish accommodation in the heart of Istanbul. Highlights include multiple restaurants, free Wi-Fi, a sauna, a spa and good transport links. Beyoglu is a vibrant cosmopolitan area across the Golden Horn from historic Constantinople. Traditionally home to European merchants and immigrants, it boasts many elegant Neoclassical and Art Nouveau structures. Nearby places of interest include the grand Taksim Square, medieval Galata Tower, modern art gallery Dogancay Museum and Istiklal Caddesi, a thriving street lined with cafes, bars, galleries and shops. Taksim tram and funicular stop and metro station is located in the vicinity, providing fast and easy access to other popular Istanbul destinations. The hotel occupies a mid-rise property with a columned entrance. Facilities include a plunge pool, sauna, steam room and a spa that offers a range of massage treatments. Free Wi-Fi is available throughout the premises. Standard rooms are 25sqm and decorated in a bright, elegant style with light wood furniture. Amenities include air-conditioning, a flat-screen satellite TV, mini-bar and safe. The en-suite bathrooms feature a bathtub with integrated shower. The Tamada restaurant offers Turkish cuisine in a charming and intimate setting, while the Terrace restaurant serves international dishes in a fantastic rooftop setting, overlooking the Bosphorus. Guests can enjoy a range of drinks and snacks at the hotel bar, while a buffet breakfast is provided every morning. The hotel has a 24-hour reception. Chargeable parking is possible onsite.
